intro: Consolida gayana, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Consolida gayana is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and can also serve as a food source for certain pollinators.
